definition: to kill two birds with one stone (idiom)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
surname Shi
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
two/2/(Beijing dialect) stupid
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
variant of 屌[diao3]/penis

sentences.english: So this is a great way to kill two birds with one stone.
sentences.chinese: 但确是一个一石二鸟的好方法。

sentences.english: Final Zhang Quanzhong hostage of one rescue of Shi Erdiao success peddles poison catch the whole lot in an action.
sentences.chinese: 最后张全忠一石二鸟成功解救人质并将毒贩一网打尽。

sentences.english: That guy revenged on his enemy by planning to kill two birds with one stone .
sentences.chinese: 那家伙计划用一石二鸟的方法向仇人报复。

sentences.english: 'The U. S. killed two birds with one stone, ' he said.
sentences.chinese: 申善浩说，美国达到了“一石二鸟”的效果。

sentences.english: Where can you hit 2 birds with 1 stone?
sentences.chinese: 在哪些事情上你可以一石二鸟呢？

sentences.english: This way! he can kill two pets with one stone.
Second, kill two birds with one stone.
In doing so, you "kill two birds with one stone".
sentences.chinese: 而你这样做的时候，同时也是一石二鸟。

definition: lit. one arrow, two golden eagles (idiom)/to kill two birds with one stone
to lend sb a knife to kill sb/to get sb else to do one's dirty work/to attack using the strength of another (idiom)
to take drastic measures to deal with a situation/to pull the carpet from under sb
one move, two gains (idiom); two birds with one stone
to satisfy rival demands (idiom)/to get the best of both worlds/to have it both ways/to have one's cake and eat it too
lit. to pull a snake from its hole/to expose a malefactor (idiom)
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
to lure the tiger from its domain in the mountains (idiom)/to lure an enemy away from his territory
a deliberate show of strength as a warning
lit. the plum tree withers in place of the peach tree/to substitute one thing for another/to carry the can for sb
to impute/to shift the blame onto someone else
exactly what one wants
lit. the cicada sheds its carapace (idiom); fig. to vanish leaving an empty shell/a crafty escape plan
excellent plan/brilliant scheme
to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
to drive a wedge between (allies, partners etc)
